file_content.text: Whoa. You look like Jaesa did that time she tried exoboar soup.
Hey. You okay? You look like me after we went out for shaclaw on Voss and you had to hold my lekku.
I had a vision. There was a galaxy neighboring our own, and then... nothing.
Every star went dim, both in that galaxy and our own. The end of everything.
See? Probably just something you ate. Maybe? I hope?
Another galaxy? Would you say it was a dwarf galaxy?
Sorry, my lov--my lord, I didn't mean to eavesdrop.
Forgive me, my lord; I couldn't help but overhear.
A dwarf galaxy sounds right. What do you know?
There is such a galaxy off the Outer Rim, known as the Rishi Maze.
Rishi? I've heard of Rishi. It's a planet. Some kind of pirate resort? Sounds like a real dive. I've kinda always wanted to go.
We get strange datamails from Rishi. We do not ask for them. Offers of free travel.
You've started receiving these recently?
Yes. Sith understands. And there is no sender.
Quinn, set a course. We're going to Rishi.
Reach out with your emotions. Let them guide you.
Yes... that's it....
Ahh!
Ashara, tell me: what did you see?
It was... it was you. You were in a jungle. Roots and vines, they took you, bound you, and then....
You were torn apart.
You saw the future. One of many possible futures, but a probable one, at the very least.
Then I heard a voice. A woman. She reached out to me through the Force. She told me you had to go to Rishi.
Rishi. You said Rishi?
I don't want you to go.
Rishi's been coming up on the navicomputer. Thought it was some kind of glitch. Nothing out there but my kind of people.
That is no glitch. It is a message.
Let me guess: you're thinking of walking straight into a trap.
An invitation for you and me to go off on a little pirate holiday? Heh, no, I know better than that.
Perhaps it is a trap. What of it?
Tell the crew there's been a change of schedule. I should very much like to visit this "Rishi"....
It not Blizz's fault!
I know you did it, Blizz. I always catch you messing with stuff.
Blizz not know what Torian mean, but boss take love-love Torian word over Blizz any day.
Blizz not know what Torian mean. Blizz not mess with any stuff, ever!
Okay, you two. Someone care to explain?
Someone plotted a course on the Mantis's navcom without running it by anyone. We were about to make the jump when I caught it.
How Blizz do that? Blizz never even hear of... what planet name?
Rishi.
I don't think it was Blizz. In fact, I'm pretty sure it wasn't anyone on the ship.
Telling me we were sliced? How were you not on top of that?
Oh, I don't know. Maybe because you've been keeping me, uh, busy?
Never saw a data routine like it before. Looks like Republic spy stuff, but modified. And that's just part of it.
Been up on the Blacklist lately? Every listing claims Rishi was the mark's last known location, including....
A bounty. On him. Right.
Guess someone wants me to go to Rishi. Well....
What kind of gal would I be if I disappointed them?
What kind of guy would I be if I disappointed them?
Hey, agent. Was kinda hoping to find you in bed. Guess you're busy.
Hey, agent. Doing a little research, huh?
It's nothing that can't wait.
Well, good, 'cause I did that sweep like you asked. Found something.
What are we looking at?
A homing beacon sends a broadcast, not a direct signal, so we can't discover directly who's tracking us.
Transceivers along our route pick up the beacon's signal. If I triangulate the origin of someone collecting the beacon's data from those transceivers....
As ever, we are enthralled with your mind. But we don't believe we have ever heard of this planet.
We are impressed. But we don't believe we have ever heard of this planet.
Rishi. I know it. Pirates and all that. Never been, though.
Then it's your lucky day, Kaliyo.
We're going to Rishi.
Lord Wrath. Per your instructions, I am transmitting the navigational coordinates for the planet Rishi now.
You're mistaken. I haven't requested any navigational data.
I... oh. Rishi? Abrion sector? Outer Rim? No?
Please forgive this error, my lord. The computer system must have suffered a failure of some kind. It won't happen again.
Uh... good day, my lord.
Greetings, my lord. It is an honor to provide the coordinates for the planet Rishi, as you requested.
I've made no such request.
I... hm. You have my sincerest apologies, my lord. We must be suffering from a computer error.
Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim... a very strange glitch. With your leave, I will investigate at once. Farewell, my lord.
Greetings... citizen. The navigational data you requested is being transmitted now: planet Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim.
What are you talking about? I never ordered any nav data.
Are you quite sure? I have your name and contact details listed quite plainly here.
Yeah. I'm sure.
Oh. Well, my apologies then. I won't trouble you any further--good day.
Good day, Commander. Per your request, I am transmitting all navigational information available for the planet Rishi.
I didn't request any navigational data.
I... hm. That's very strange. Your credentials and request are quite clear here: planet Rishi, Abrion sector, Outer Rim.
Must be some kind of computer error. I will ensure that it doesn't happen again--apologies for the inconvenience, Commander.
That was no mistake. We must go to Rishi.
If someone is trying to get my attention... they have succeeded.
I'm either being messed with or sent a message--I don't care which. We're going to Rishi.
"Computer error." No, I don't think so.
